question:
Lord Cornwallis established four courts of the circuit at which of the following places?
1) Calcutta
2) Dacca
3) Murshidabad
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Charles Cornwallis also called Lord Cornwallis succeeded Warren Hastings. He established four courts of the circuit at Calcutta, Dacca, Murshidabad, and Patna. Each presided over by two judges assisted by two Kazis and two Muftis.
